lines.text: I just wish I knew your angle, Saint. Whose side are you on.
I'm on my own side.
Where does that put me?
That depends. If you were cleverer than you look, you'll be on my side.
But I never squealed on anyone in my life.
If you don't start now, you'll never have another chance.
Rocky is still at his night club.
Now, wait a minute, Simon. Why can't I go to a nightclub? I'll not be party to any rough stuff.

[Dismissively]
You toddle off to bed like a good boy. These denizens of iniquity are no place for a respectable married man. I'll just drift into Rocky's gin palace and see what's going on.
What have you got there?
[Reading newspaper story]
New York Police Inspector cries "Foul!" Etc., etc. John Henry Fernack of the Homicide Bureau unable to explain the source of $50,000 found in his safe
[Simon smiles slightly]
... so and so forth.
Could have said he won it on a horse or roulette or something.
Fernack is much too honest for that.
...or too stupid.
Well, let's drink to him anyway. Seems to me he'll need more than that. Maybe he needs a guardian angel.
Or a patron saint.
What are you going to do?
That, darling, is the big problem of the moment.
